content.description: This route shares the first two bolts of Avoider climbing up the white rock on great huecos.  First bolt is 20' high, look for an old bee nest.  A 2" cam between the first and second bolts can make this less runnout but is not necessary.    From the second bolt climb through the roof following bolts up amazing pockets and tofas to the anchor just past the lip left of the roof.  Bring an extendible for the anchor.
content.location: These climbs are located in the high roof area of the upper left cliff.  Access is gained by scrambling up the gully between the two main lower walls then cut left under the large overhanging sections of wall.

content.description: This route is half a rope length left of the previous climbs.  This route starts at a belay bolt located six feet up under an overhang.  Then climb up and right threw a few roofs of blocky angled rocks.  Then pull an upper roof crux.  The upper section of this route is now occupied by a large bird nest with most ledges being covered in bird shit.  The anchor is located on the upper lip of the formation.
content.location: This route is located 90 feet left of the last set of climbs. It is the left most climb at the crag and has a large bird nest under the anchor.

content.description: Topless is located 15' right of the green bolt.  Start under the roof with two pocket holds that can look like an elephant eyes and trunk after a few PBR's.  Pull through the roof on a left gun sight weakness then continue past a single bolt and on the the anchor.
content.location: This climb is located in the high roof area of the upper left cliff. Access is gained by scrambling up the gully between the two main lower walls.

content.description: Stand Up Wise Up starts climbing up white colored rock on huge huecos to the first bolt of Avoider (25')then pulls the roof to the right.  Fight up the 45 degree roof to a small gap that will put you on an arete.  Follow this to the anchor located just below the upper most roof.
content.location: These climbs are located in the high roof area of the upper left cliff.  Access is gained by scrambling up the gully between the two main lower walls then cut left under the large overhanging sections of wall.

content.description: Soul Surfer climbs past two bolts on the slab.  The first two bolts on the overhanging section can be clipped off of good jugs.  Bolt number 5 is a piece of angle iron.  Fight straight up to the middle hanging anchor.  The crux is at the top of this route.
content.location: These climbs are located in the high roof area of the upper left cliff.  Access is gained by scrambling up the gully between the two main lower walls then cut left under the large overhanging sections of wall.

content.description: This Open project clips the first two bolts on the lower angle wall then cuts left under the overhang.  Clip two bolts on the face near a right trending seam that starts from the roof in the upper left corner of the overhanging face.  Follow this to the middle hanging belay.
content.location: These climbs are located in the high roof area of the upper left cliff.  Access is gained by scrambling up the gully between the two main lower walls then cut left under the large overhanging sections of wall.

content.description: I Against I has the same start as Soul Surfer.  Clip two bolts then traverse left under the roof for twenty five feet.  The crack at the base of the roof takes good gear.  Follow this to a small, blocky roof.  Pull the lip and climb a slab up and right to the anchor.
content.protection: 2 Bolts, Gear to 3", 1 Bolt+ 1 Fixed Wire Anchor
content.location: These climbs are located in the high roof area of the upper left cliff.  Access is gained by scrambling up the gully between the two main lower walls then cut left under the large overhanging sections of wall.

content.description: Freedom Fighter climbs past a bolt with no hanger then cuts right passing over some bird shit rocks.  Lock into a right trending seam past a bolt located 7 feet up the overhanging wall.  Continue up on gear to the right most anchor.  This anchor could use some new webbing.
content.location: These climbs are located in the high roof area of the upper left cliff.  Access is gained by scrambling up the gully between the two main lower walls then cut left under the large overhanging sections of wall.

content.description: Bush Doctor Starts from a belay bolt 6 feet under a green angle iron hanger.  Use an extendable on the angle then climb up and right under the overhang.  Climb the dihedral to the upper face and on to the anchor.  Use gear between the second and third bolt to cut down on the runnout factor.  Look out for loose rock at the lip.
content.protection: 8 Bolts, Gear to 2", 2 Bolt Chain Anchor
content.location: These climbs are located in the high roof area of the upper left cliff.  Access is gained by scrambling up the gully between the two main lower walls.

content.description: Avoider starts climbing up white, dirty yet awesome looking hueco fetchers.  There was a bee nest 20 feet off the deck in 2014.  Clip the first bolt at 25' then cut left under the roof.  A second bolt is locate 40' high with gear available through the route.  Keep trending up and left till you pass the lip then follow dirty rock to the anchor around right.
content.protection: 3 Bolts, Gear to 3", 1 Bolt+ 1 Piton Anchor
content.location: These climbs are located in the high roof area of the upper left cliff.  Access is gained by scrambling up the gully between the two main lower walls then cut left under the large overhanging sections of wall.

content.description: American Bulldog shares the same two bolts as Soul Surfer then climbs up into an overhanging cave type fetcher at the left side of the overhang.  Clip a bolt past the roof then fight straight up on good holds to the hanging anchor 40 feet up.
content.protection: 3 Bolts, Trad Rack to 3", 2 Bolt Anchor
content.location: These climbs are located in the high roof area of the upper left cliff.  Access is gained by scrambling up the gully between the two main lower walls then cut left under the large overhanging sections of wall.

content.description: The Left Wall section of Puriton Creek encompass the upper left section of rock at the main cliffs.  There are some large roofs and nice steep, shorter faces up in the area.  The routes at this part of the wall all seem to be 5.10 or 5.12 with nothing in the middle.  If overhanging faces and powerful moves are what you love than this is an area that will make you smile.
